question: What does HTML stand for?

options: Makes the first word of every paragraph red and twice as big
Applies red color and large font to the first letter of every paragraph
Applies a red border around the paragraph's first line
Changes the text color of the entire paragraph to red
answer: Applies red color and large font to the first letter of every paragraph

tags inside a div?

What styles do the following classes apply?

class="text-center text-lg font-bold"
options: Aligns text to the left, sets font size to large, makes text italic
Centers text, sets large font size, makes text bold
Justifies text, adds margin, sets font size to medium
Left-aligns text, makes text bold, increases line height
answer: Centers text, sets large font size, makes text bold

question:
What styles do the following classes apply?

class="bg-blue-500 text-white p-4 rounded"
options: Sets white background, blue text, padding of 4px, and no border-radius
Applies blue background, white text, 1rem padding, and rounded corners
Makes text bold, adds a shadow, and sets height to 4rem
Only changes text color and padding
answer: Applies blue background, white text, 1rem padding, and rounded corners

question:
What styles do the following classes apply?

class="flex items-center justify-between"
options: Uses grid layout, centers all items vertically and horizontally
Enables flexbox, aligns items to the start and wraps them
Enables flexbox, aligns items vertically in center, distributes space between them
Adds margins and paddings to all sides
answer: Enables flexbox, aligns items vertically in center, distributes space between them

question: What is a key difference between Flexbox and CSS Grid?
options: Flexbox is used for two-dimensional layouts, while Grid is used for one-dimensional layouts.
Grid is better for text alignment, while Flexbox is only for positioning images.
Flexbox is best for one-dimensional layouts (either row or column), while Grid is best for two-dimensional layouts (rows and columns).
They are exactly the same but have different names.
answer: Flexbox is best for one-dimensional layouts (either row or column), while Grid is best for two-dimensional layouts (rows and columns).

question: What property controls spacing outside the border?
What property controls spacing inside the border?
Which value makes text bold?
How do you center text in CSS?
What property is used for rounded corners?
Which statement correctly describes the difference between inline, internal, and external stylesheets?
options: Inline styles are written in a separate .css file, internal styles are added using the style attribute, and external styles are placed in the head tag.
Inline styles are added directly to an HTML element, internal styles are written inside a `<style>` tag, and external styles are written in a separate .css file and linked.
Internal styles are always applied last, and inline styles override external styles.
External styles are always stronger than internal and inline styles.
answer: Inline styles are added directly to an HTML element, internal styles are written inside a `<style>` tag, and external styles are written in a separate .css file and linked.
